title: Russian billionaire showers business conference attendees with $20,000 in one dollar bills
text:
A Russian tycoon has stunned a business conference by releasing a 'rain shower' of cash worth $20,000 into the audience.

Building magnate Igor Rybakov, 47, told his audience he wanted to help young Russian entrepreneurs get started and be successful.

A video shows people scrambled to pick up the money - all in $1 bills - at the Gazprom Arena in St Petersburg.

He told the Synergy Global 2019 business forum how he began building his $1.3 billion fortune when his father Vladimir, a Communist-era engineer, gave him just $1.

His dad told him to multiply the money - then share it, he recalled.

He did so and is one of the 100-plus Russians to become dollar billionaires during the Vladimir Putin era.

The building material billionaire (pictured in front of a private helicopter) said his speaking fee for the popular forum was $200,000, so he was giving $20,000 away as a 'cash back'

Wearing a hoodie emblazoned with his name in English, Rybakov declared: 'My father gave me this ticket. I am passing it on to you. Take it, multiply it - and share it. It's real'

He said his speaking fee for the popular forum was $200,000, so he was giving $20,000 away as a 'cash back'.

Rybakov, from industrial city Magnitogorsk, is a founder of TechnoNICOL Corporation, Russia's largest producer of roofing and insulation materials and systems.

A married father of four, he is also known as an author of books on successful business and a philanthropist.
